org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.fogbus

Class FogBusProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.Provider<T,S>
      • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AndroidProvider<T,S>
        • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AsyncProvider<T,S>
          • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.SequentialProvider<T,S>
            • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.fogbus.FogBusProvider<T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of input data
    S - the type of output data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HealthKeeperProvider

    public abstract class FogBusProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
extends SequentialProvider<T,S>
    Simple provider skeleton for FogBus. User needs to implement the following classes:
    • getMasterIP()
    • getSessionUrl()
    • #serializeData(ProgressPublisher, Data[])
    • #parseOutput(ProgressPublisher, String, long)
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Nested Class Summary

      • FogBusProvider

        public FogBusProvider(boolean analyze,
                      java.lang.Class<T> inputType,
                      java.lang.Class<S> outputType)
        Create a provider that sends data to FogBus and, optionally, analyzes it.
        Parameters:
        analyze - true if data will be analyzed, false otherwise.
        inputType - the type of input data
        outputType - the type of output data

    • Method Detail

        Called when an ExecutionManager is attached, returns the IP of the master node, to which sending the requests.
        Returns:
        the IP of the master node.
        See Also:
        onAttach()

      • getSessionUrl

        protected abstract java.lang.String getSessionUrl()
        Called when an ExecutionManager is attached, returns the url of the session page, to which sending the requests.

        See Also:

      • serializeData

        protected abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> serializeData(AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher progressPublisher,
                                                                                                   T... input)
                                                                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Called outside the Main Thread, serializes data to send to FogBus. FogBus input uses HTTP GET parameters of the type "dataX=v1,v2,v3,...". This function must return a map where the keys are the indexes to append to data and the list of strings the value to be serialized in the csv.
        Parameters:
        progressPublisher - used to publish progress.
        input - the data in input to be serialized.
        Returns:
        the map as previously described.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any error.
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.getData(ProgressPublisher, long, Data[])

      • parseOutput

        protected abstract S[] parseOutput(AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher progressPublisher,
                                   java.lang.String output,
                                   long requestID)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses the output array from the server response.
        Parameters:
        progressPublisher - used to publish progress.
        output - the response of the FogBus server.
        requestID - the requestID of the input data.
        Returns:
        the array with the outputs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any error
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.getData(ProgressPublisher, long, Data[])

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach()
        Description copied from class: Provider
        Performs actions after the ExecutionManager is bound. It does nothing unless overridden.

      • getData

        public S[] getData(AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher progressPublisher,
                   long requestID,
                   T... input)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AsyncProvider
        Provides the data given some input data. It will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[])
        Specified by:
        getData in class AsyncProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
        Parameters:
        progressPublisher - interface for publishing progress through Provider.publishProgress(long, int, String) by using AsyncTask.publishProgress(Object[]) and AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onProgressUpdate(ProgressData[]).
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        input - the input data.
        Returns:
        the output data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception thrown will be caught in and passed to AsyncProvider.onPostExecuteError(long, Throwable).
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[]), AsyncProvider.execute(long, Data[])

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the previously set read timeout in milliseconds (default = 10000).
